lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Scocozza and Deputy Assistant Attorney General Roger Andewelt said both departments felt airlines should be judged under the same antitrust standards as all other industries.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Andewelt said he was optimistic competition would increase as airlines expanded airport hubs and routes and believed the industry did not need special treatment under antitrust laws.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But Assistant Transportation Secretary Matthew Scocozza said at a Senate antitrust committee hearing he would not object to a transfer of the department's authority over airline mergers to the Justice Department.
